Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [looking at Angela's costume] Approved!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [claps] Chef from South Park, it's genius!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Just some chef.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've decided to pre-screen all the Halloween costumes this year. I have three simple rules - don't be offensive, don't be cliche, and don't take the first two rules too seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The gorilla from Rise of the Planet of the Apes? Huh? The one who sacrifices his life.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! Aw, spoiler alert.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's been out for ages, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Costume vetoed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah, it's, uh... somebody's already called that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin has a gorilla suit you could borrow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous! Why can't there just be two Kate Middleton's?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys, I know, I mean, I wish there could be, too. It's like, I can't choose. They're both amazing. It's just...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Look, I stayed up all night and I watched that gd wedding, and then I came to work and I made everyone else watch it all day. Meredith wasn't even here.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Because I was there. [shows Kelly her cell phone video] Your the people's princess! Diana was nothing!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I thought you were at your sister's funeral.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What I said was, "My sister's funeral is this weekend." Didn't say I'd be there.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why is it such a shock that I follow the royal story? Warms my heart, thinking about them two kids, doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, can I, maybe, squeeze through?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There you go. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: When they talk about all the nice things about dating a coworker, they don't mention one of the best parts. After you're done dating, you still get to work together, every single day.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jim, put it on.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Put it on, man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know if I can.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Come on, the Three Amigos.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Three Kings.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know, I know, I know. But Darryl and Kevin needed a third. They bought me this jersey. I said no. Kevin started crying. So, I am Chris Bosh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to Kelly] If you get into season 1, you can really...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [Dwight walks in] Oh my god, what the hell is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's called a costume.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What are you, some kind of Jamaican zombie woman?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan, will you please tell her who I am?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Whoopi Goldberg.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Has no one here heard of Kerrigan, from Starcraft? Queen of blades? It's all Toby's fault.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Every Halloween I tell him the same thing - You can't bring weapons into the office, and every year he says the same thing - As soon as I get my weapons back I'm gonna kill you. But there I am at Thanksgiving, alive, you know. I'm a lucky turkey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everybody looking good, this is, this is the best we can do? I'm not judging, I, I think you guys look great, I just... wanna make sure this is the best we can do?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just got a text from Broccoli Rob - "Boo!" Scared me. And then I got this text from Robert California - "Looking forward to Halloween party. Expectations are high." Scared the s**t out of me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: G'day, Pameroo. Could you shoot this off for me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Australian accent...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [faxing, Erin watching over her shoulder] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I just wanted to see how you do it, if you're doing something I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. [sends fax, Erin nods] Are you...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That Andy, so hot and cold. One day he's like, fax these documents, please. The next he's like, Pam, you fax them, who cares what Erin's feeling, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Erin...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam, how would you rate me as a receptionist on a scale of 1 to 3?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, 2?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's like, the second to last thing I wanted to hear.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean, you're doing great, and Andy put you in charge of the whole party, right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Send completed. You are the best in the biz, I can't deny.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bob and I are doing this Scranton Haunted Walking Tour.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I always wondered what kind of people went on that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, if you go by the Banshee Pub, tell the Man In Black I say hello.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [sigh] What happened, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. When I was 22, I worked there and everybody said the place was haunted. I didn't believe it until one day before we opened, I look up into the mirror, you know, behind the bar, and I see this old man dressed all in black, but when I turn around, there's no one there. So, I tell the cook my story...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wait, they have food there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...and he said, That's what everyone sees, that's the Man In Black.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No! My wife does not believe in ghosts.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, this Man In Black thing, what do you think that was about?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Was it, like, trickery in the lights, or maybe you were so primed to see it, then there it was?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I saw a ghost.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. No, but what I'm saying is, like, do you ever wonder what it was?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was a ghost, I told you this on, like, our first date.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I had just told you about the day that I met the Blue Angels. I figured you had to top it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know what to tell you, Jim, but I saw a ghost.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Uh-oh, looks like we're under a Jack attack!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yes, Andrew. And you, on this day of fantasy, are a laborer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Everyone, this Bert, my son. Bert, this is... a paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [everyone greets Bert]

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Hello. Can I use a computer? I need to check a hurricane.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Here, use this one. [walking to Jim's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim shakes his head "no", Andy motions to him to "shh"]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh, look, Pin The Wart On The Wench. How did you know I was bringing my son?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I didn't. It was for us, but he can play. Bertie-boy, would you like to play this game?

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: That stuff's for babies.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well, perhaps this party will awaken the baby in all of us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, who shot our grown-up party with a kiddie raygun? We're still getting it set up, it's gonna be really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughing] Extraordinary. Did you plan this?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, Toby and I did, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: And I overheard, and thought, hey, that'd be fun, don't mind if I do.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: If you turn out the lights we'll do a little dance.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe/Kelly/Toby
Quote.Text: [singing and dancing] Dem bones, dem bones, dem tired bones, now we're the skeleton crew.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughing and clapping] Delightful.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Gabe mumbles]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Now then, how are we today?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Just fine, Kelly? Everything alright?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You feeling fulfilled in your life?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You guess? So, there is something you want that you do not have.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I try not to think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Because it's too terrifying to imagine. Now we're cooking. What is it, Kelly? What is this great fear of yours?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Never marrying.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yes. Dying alone, that is very scary. And how are you, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So great.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Angela takes the pumpking decoration off of the window]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I put those up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know. I'm taking them down.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I almost wonder if putting nothing on this wall is more Halloween-y.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know about this, guys, Andy put me in charge of the Halloween party, so...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, Andy sent us in here, so which is it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So, can we speak our minds now, or are we still sparing feelings, because I hate all of this.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Very low pressure in the Sargasso Sea, warm air from South America, cold air from Greenland. All signs point to the perfect storm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, perfectly mediocre.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: What are you, anyway?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm a Jamaican zombie woman, leave me alone, ghoul.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: If you had some really big wings with blades on the end, you'd kind of look like Kerrigan from Starcraft.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damnit. I AM Kerrigan from Starcraft! I've been censored.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: If you're going to be a Zerg, at least be a Lurker, not some girl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kerrigan is ruler of the Zerg swarm!

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Yeah, she also has boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but no nipples.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: November's sure creeping up, ain't it? Can't stop that month!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, what's the jive with Angela and Phyllis helping with the party, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, I just thought you could use some help, you know, because Robert came in and thought the party seemed a little kiddie, and I guess I agreed, and maybe we could mix a little more 13 into the PG.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But that's it? There's nothing about me, or I?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can we talk about it at the end of the day? I gotta call, gotta make a call.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, sorry. Yes, we can.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [pretending to be on the phone] Yes. [laughs] I don't know. Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Sweetheart.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm throwing the Halloween Party and I just want to amp it up a little. I think it could use some extra pizazz.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok where does Gabe factor in?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Remember that Halloween party you took me to once? The one where I started crying as soon as I walked in and I didn't stop crying?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes. Lars and Decocco's

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ok. Let's say that I wanted this party to be a tiny, tiny bit like that one. Just... more adult... more... scary and sexy

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I will make this sexier than you could ever imagine.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No - just scary. If we wanted ideas for scary stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [laughs, eventually Erin joins him laughing] Oh that would be scary!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok let me go get it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Pam Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey it's Jim Halpert. I was wondering if you wanted to see a movie tonight. Because I've read a lot about this really great documentary.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it called Ghostbusters?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] It's called Ghostbusters.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It didn't look like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It didn't have a buster sign around him? Why don't you draw him? Why don't we see this whole thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok fine I'll draw him. [hangs up phone and draws]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I ain't fraid of no ghost. [Pam holds up drawing of a hand with the middle finger raised] Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmhmm. Dwight are you eating a stick?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a root you idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Everyone hates you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's really rude. I don't tell you hurricanes suck even though it's true.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: What do you like? Tornadoes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Try influenza.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Oh yeah? What's the vaccine you can take to avoid a hurricane?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Open up a newspaper. Oh look a hurricane's coming. I suppose you're going to tell me the scariest animal is a shark?

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Try a box jelly fish.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know that's...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What are we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was talking about my wife and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate and Meredith said she believes in them too.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] You seem unimpressed. Ghosts don't scare you?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm only scared of real things like serial killers and kidnappers. Not things that don't exist like ghosts or mummies.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Mummies are real. There are mummies at museums.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah [nervously]...prank

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's true. They've been preserved for thousands of years. They're all over.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [screaming] Why on Earth would a museum put a mummy in it?!?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Witch's brew?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I grew this party up real fast. Get out of here little kid party. Nobody loves you. And clean up your room! Grownups are going to use it later! Oooh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Party looks fun doesn't it? Everybody seems to be in there having a great time. So maybe now would be a great time for me to pop back on the computer.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: I'm using it. I'm about to play Starcraft with him [points to Dwight].

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah I'm serious.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's funny. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Loser.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pam do you think anyone's going to notice I've worn this costume before? When I wasn't pregnant. You know I bet nobody would believe it still fits.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey guys. I'm an Oscar [gestures to face] liar [gestures to nametag saying "Representative Weiner] weiner.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This party's tight. The fog is cool.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thanks. It's on medium.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It really looks great. You did a great job.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, so we don't have to have that talk.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We should still have that talk. Maybe you can come by my office at like 4:45? [Erin nods] Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [in ghostly voice] Oookayyy everybody. Be prepared to be scared. Ok. [hits play on DVD player, "Do yes disturb meditations of horror" appears on screen, Gabe winks at Erin, on screen food deflates, a mouse crawls across a photograph of a woman, a person brushes very dirty teeth]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The cinema of the unsettling is a growing film movement. The most well known film in the genre is an hour long shot of a squirrel with diarrhea.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [cuts back to a Happy Birthday cake gushing blood when cut into, a doll melts, a woman eats food and puckers her face] Is that my grandmother?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's the story?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There is no story.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah it seems like there isn't a narrative. [on screen a man gets into a car] Maybe the filmmaker realized that even narrative is comforting.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What the hell is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think we've seen enough. You can turn it off now. [everyone murmurs agreement] Yeah turn it off now.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How did you get in my car?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Where is this from? That is so upsetting!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was awful. Robert I apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I got confused. I heard you wanted to make the party more adult. But I think I know what to do now [grabs box]. This game is called "pecker Poker". [fighting tears] It's the game of cards that gets you hard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What we have here is a classic misunderstanding.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Why didn't you simply ask Andy to clarify? Asking is a very easy thing to do. You're obviously very close. [Andy and Erin look awkwardly at each other and Robert]. Oh I see. This no longer seems like my business [Robert sits].

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: All I know is you wanted to have a talk with me and I got nervous so...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You were going to talk at the end of the... I'm not here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you think I was going to fire you? No I wasn't. [to Robert] I'm sorry this must be really uncomfortable for you.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm never uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok. Erin I think you know I've been dating someone.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And it's getting a little more serious. She's never come by.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And she's never called here. Unless it's your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No I didn't want her to call because I thought it would be weird. But now it's weird that she's not calling.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Two dates? Three dates?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thirty-one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow. I'm so happy for you guys. Um let me know when you get to forty. I'll see you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I should go.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I just don't get it, Pam. I mean, you're a rational person.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispering] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim doesn't let me wash his NFL jersey during the playoffs. How is this any less logical?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Careful, whoa. First of all, it's not like I think that's going to help the Eagles win.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. That is just a bunch of people participating in a collective thing that maybe the Eagles will hear about and want to play better. It's not...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go, get up there right now.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanna attack or let them come to us? Your call, B.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Unleash the hellstorm.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got 'em. Go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is she Asian?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know. She's from somewhere, I bet. Maybe from the forest.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Forest? Did Andy say his girlfriend's from the forest?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know, Phyllis. Maybe she's from the city.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Looks terribly real, doesn't it, Creed?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Are you scared of snakes?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You don't live as long as I have without a healthy fear of snakes, Bobby.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [in the bathroom with Robert[ Yeah, I guess sometimes I have nightmares about being buried alive.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [talking to Robert] Honestly, Jim gives me the creeps.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [to camera] What am I up to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Like, a few years down the road, Cece says, "Mom, there's a ghost in my closet." Now, you say one of two things - one, "You're just having a bad dream," or two, "Let's go see what it was."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna freak her out, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna lie to her, either.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: When I was a boy, there was an empty house just up the hill from my family's. It was rumored a man committed suicide there after being possessed by the devil. One day, a young woman, Lydia, moved into the house with her infant child. That very night, Lydia was awakened by a loud, heinous hissing sound. [hisses] She walked to the nursery, and there, in baby's crib, was a snake wrapped around baby's neck, squeezing tighter and tighter.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The crib was full of dirt. Baby struggled to free itself from underneath, reaching and clawing, gasping for air. Embalmed bodies rose from their sarcophagi, lurching toward baby, for they were mummies.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nooo!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Amongst them was a man, tall, slim.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Jim. [rolls eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Almost instinctively, she turned to her husband. "Oh, wait," she thought, "I don't have a husband." For Lydia and her husband had had an argument, one they couldn't get past. Each night, they slept one inch farther apart, until one night, Lydia left. It was about this time she lost herself in imaginary worlds. She had quit the book club, the choir, citing something about their high expectations. Her lips slowly grew together from disuse. Everytime she wanted to act and didn't, another part of her face hardened, until it was stone. And that fevered night, she rushed to the nursery, threw open the door, "Baby, are you okay?" Baby sat up slowly, turned to mother and said, "I'm fine, b!tch, I'm fine."

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Fear plays an interesting role in our lives. How dare we let it motivate us. How dare we let it into our decision making, into our livelihoods, into our relationships. It's funny, isn't it, we take a day a year to dress up in costume and celebrate fear.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Bert. Wanna see the dance? Dem bones, dem bones, dem dry...

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: You're fired.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...bones. What?

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: You heard me. Pack your things.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What... you can't... Gabe? Are you...

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: I'm the CEO's son. Pack your things. You're done.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pink is the red-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What are we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was talking about my wife, and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate. Meredith said she believes in them too.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Have you seen a ghost?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Seen and banged.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hmph.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ok, I met him in a bar, right? There's something weird about him. He doesn't smell right, the clothes are all tattered and dirty and from another age. Anyways, we end up back and my place and we go at it all night-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Meredith, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, no. I'm very comfortable with all things sexual. Continue.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I wake up the next morning, all my stuff's gone. Whole house turned over. No trace. You tell me what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Have you considered the possibility that you slept with a drifter?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: He didn't smell like a drifter.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: What are you anyway?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm a Jamaican zombie woman. Leave me alone, ghoul.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: I'm a zombie from Walking Dead. It's a show.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, I know what it is. Ok? I have like a thousand people over every week to watch it. Ok? We all kinda hate it though.

Quote.Speaker: Bert
Quote.Text: Who's your favorite character?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The city of Atlanta.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If ghosts are real, how come everyone knows what they look like? It's not like a bunch of people got together and agreed on a lie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Interesting. Every culture holds this true. Clearly, there's some sort of real phenomenon out there...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oscar, how are you on that side?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This isn't about sides. This is about me seeing a blueish gray old man in the mirror and then he vanishes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Pam, this is important. Was he me? Am I him?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But that would make more sense. [Pam sighs]
